intro: Platystemon purpuratus, commonly known as the purple-stemmed flatstem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive purple-colored stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it prefers full sun to partial shade.
